file-selector.size-limit: File size should less than {size} MiB

task.earliest-allowed-time-hint: @:{'task.rollout-time'} is when you want a task to run; if unspecified, it runs when all criteria are met.
task.earliest-allowed-time-no-modify: You cannot modify this field because you are not the issue assignee or it's not pending to run.

rollback.sql-rollback-tips:
When enabled, Bytebase will keep the rollback logs for the data change
and allow you to create a new issue to revert this change.
Warning: If the table does not have a primary key. Undo SQL may affect
duplicate rows. Please carefully confirm before executing.
{link}

task.skip-failed-in-current-stage: Skip failed tasks in current stage

apply-change-to-all-pending-tasks.title: Apply change to all pending tasks?
apply-change-to-all-pending-tasks.self: Apply change to all pending tasks
apply-change-to-all-pending-tasks.current-only: Only apply change to current task

error.some-tasks-are-not-editable-in-batch-mod: Some tasks are not editable in batch mode

not-applicable.some-tasks-dont-meet-ghost-requirement: Some tasks don't meet gh-ost's requirement

banner.license-expires: Your license for {plan} has expired on {expireAt}.
banner.trial-expires: Your free trial for {plan} will expire in {days} days on {expireAt}.
banner.trial-expired: Your free trial for {plan} has expired.
banner.readonly: Bytebase is in readonly mode. You can still view the console, but any change attempt will fail.

members.helper: Add or invite by email address

tooltip.not-allow-edit: Only Owner can change the role
tooltip.project-role-provider-gitlab: Mapped from the {rawRole} role in the corresponding GitLab project.
tooltip.cannot-change-role-of-systembot-or-servi: Cannot change the role of system bot or service account

members.reset-service-key-alert: This action cannot be undone. The old key will stop working immediately. Are you sure you want to reset this service key?
members.service-key-copied: Service Key copied to clipboard, please keep it in secret.

remove-self-owner.title: Are you sure to revoke OWNER from yourself?
remove-self-owner.description: Please make sure the remaining OWNER(s) can sign in, otherwise, no one can manage users.

im-integration.description: Allow users to approve issues from IM directly.

sso.description: Single Sign-On (SSO) is an authentication method that enables users to authenticate with multiple applications and websites via a single set of credentials.
sso.archive-info: Archived SSO will not be shown on the normal interface. You can click "Archive" on the bottom left to find and restore it.

form.redirect-url-description: It will be used to fill in the appropriate field in the identity provider application form.
form.name: Name
form.name-description: The display name to be shown to the users
form.resource-id-description: An unique string, and valid characters are /[a-z][0-9]-/
form.identity-provider-information-descriptio: The information is provided by your identity provider.
form.identity-provider-needed-information: Create your SSO application with the following information.
form.endpoints-description: The related urls provided by your OAuth provider.
form.auth-url-description: The link to OAuth login page
form.scopes-description: A space-separated list of scopes to be carried when accessing the Auth URL
form.token-url-description: The API address for obtaining accessToken
form.user-info-url-description: The API address for obtaining user information by accessToken
form.connection-security-skip-tls-verify: Skip TLS verify for self-signed certificates
form.user-information-mapping-description: Maps the field names from user info API to the Bytebase user.
form.identifier-tips: It should be a unique string. And if it is not in email format, it will be spliced with domain.

workspace.only-owner-can-edit: Only workspace owner can update the settings.
workspace.logo-aspect: The suggested logo size should be 5:2 aspect ratio, e.g 100 x 40.

watermark.description: Display watermarks on pages, including username, ID and email.
watermark.only-owner-can-edit: Only workspace owner can update watermark setting.

disallow-signup.description: Once disabled, users cannot self-service signup and can only be invited by the workspace owner.

require-2fa.enable: Require two-factor authentication for all users
require-2fa.description: When enabled, users who do not have two-factor authentication enabled for their personal accounts will be forced to configure.
require-2fa.need-all-user-2fa-enabled: Requires all users to enable 2FA first. There are still {count} users who have not enabled 2FA: {users}

external-url.description: The external URL where user visits Bytebase, must start with http:// or https://.

gitops-webhook-url.description: The URL used for sending GitOps webhooks to the Bytebase instance.

sign-in-frequency.description: Sign-in frequency is the period before a user must sign in again.
sign-in-frequency.config-updated: Configuration is updated. Need to restart Bytebase and re-login to take effect.

openai-key.description: Supply OpenAI API Key to enable ChatSQL capability in SQL Editor. {viewDoc}
openai-key.placeholder: An OpenAI API Key usually starts with sk-*****

openai-endpoint.description: Supply private deployment of OpenAI API Endpoint.

announcement.owner-or-dba-can-edit: Only workspace owner or DBA can update announcement setting.

announcement-text.description: To hide the announcement, leave it empty.

sensitive-data.description: Following columns are explicitly assigned masking levels and take predence over the global masking rule.

global-rules.description: Use global rule to apply masking levels in batch, e.g. all columns named as "email" will be masked with "Partial" level.

column-detail.access-user-list-desc: Users granted to access de-masked data.
column-detail.column-effective-masking-tips:
This column doesn't configure its own masking level.
We're showing its effective masking level with global masking rules. {link}

full-mask.substitution-label: Substitution is the string used to replace the original value, the max length of the string is 16 bytes.

range-mask.slice-start-label: Slice start is the start index of the original value, start from 0 and should be less than stop.
range-mask.slice-end-label: Slice stop is the stop index of the original value, should be less than the length of the original value.
range-mask.substitution-label: Substitution is the string used to replace the original value from start to end.

md5-mask.salt-label: Salt is the salt value to generate a different hash that with the word alone.

access-control.description: Configure approval flow to control data query and export. {link}

release.new-version-content: The new version {tag} is available now! Please check our docs for installation.
release.not-show-till-next-release: Don't show this till next version

mail-delivery.description: Configuring SMTP information will enable users to receive database reports via email, such as slow query weekly reports.
mail-delivery.updated-tip: Successfully updated the mail delivery setting
mail-delivery.tested-tip: Send successfully, please check the inbox of {address}.

type.database-recovery-pitr-done: Restore database to point in time

sentence.external-approval-rejected: rejected external approval from {imName} of stage "{stageName}"

toolbar.hashtag: Insert issue's link by id. Type the issue id after the hashtag "#"

project.title: Project
project.description: Include only issues from this project

instance.title: Instance
instance.description: Include only issues related with the instance

database.title: Database
database.description: Include only issues related with the database

type.title: Change Type
type.description: The database change type for issues

principal.title: Related Principal
principal.description: Search by the issue creator, assignee or subscriber

issue.not-allowed-to-operate-unassigned-databa:
Can't {operation} to unassigned databases.
It need to be transferred to a project first.

normal.title: Normal migration (for normal-sized table)
normal.description: Perform schema change directly on the target table. A lock will be held during the entire migration.

online.title: Online migration (for large-sized table)
online.description: Based on gh-ost. For large tables, it can reduce the table lock duration from hours to seconds {link}.

issue.edit-sql-statement-in-vcs: This project has enabled VCS based version control. Please modify the SQL file in the corresponding Git repository, and commit it to create a new issue.
issue.statement-from-sheet-warning: SQL is oversized and inline-editing is disallowed. You can upload a new SQL file to overwrite it.

batch-transition.not-allowed-tips: Some of selected issues cannot be {operation}
batch-transition.successfully-updated-n-issues: Successfully updated {n} issue | Successfully updated {n} issues

sql-hint.change-will-apply-to-all-tasks-in-tenant: The change will be applied to all tasks
sql-hint.dont-apply-to-database-in-baseline-migra: Baselining only records the current schema in the change history and won't apply the SQL to the database
sql-hint.snowflake: Use <<schema>>.<<table>> to specify a Snowflake table

sdl.left-schema-may-change: The schema on the left side may change before the issue is applied.

issue.assignee-tooltip: The assignees are those responsible for an issue, and when an issue is assigned to them, it shows up in their list of assigned issues.

approval-flow.tooltip: The approvers will review and approve the issue in the order specified in the flow. The issue can only be applied after all steps in the flow have been approved. You can configure a custom approval flow for each risk.

grant-request.all-databases-tip: All current and future databases in this project.
grant-request.data-export-attention: The data will be exported to a file and downloaded to your local machine. And you can only do the export action once.

update-statement.current-change-will-apply-to-all-tasks-i: In batch mode, current change will be applied to all tasks.

issue.not-editable-legacy-issue: This issue is not editable because it was created in an old version of Bytebase

disallow-edit-reasons.task-is-running-cancel-first: The task is running, cancel task before changing this value

issue.you-are-not-allowed-to-change-this-value: You are not allowed to change this value

no-configured-sql-review-policy.admin: {environment} environment has not configured SQL Review Policy. {link}
no-configured-sql-review-policy.developer: {environment} environment has not configured SQL Review Policy. Please ask your DBA to configure.

error.you-don-have-privilege-to-edit-this-issu: You don't have privilege to edit this issue

alter-schema.vcs-enabled: This project has enabled VCS based version control and selecting database below will navigate you to the corresponding Git repository to initiate the change process.
alter-schema.vcs-info: VCS enabled. Selecting this will navigate you to the corresponding Git repository to initiate the change process.
alter-schema.no-databases-in-project: No databases in this project. Click New DB or Transfer in DB to add databases.

quick-action.transfer-in-db-alert: Are you sure to transfer "{ dbName }" into our project?
quick-action.unassigned-db-hint: Newly synced databases start unassigned and must be moved to a project for use.

db.failed-to-sync-schema-for-database-datab: Failed to sync schema for database '{0}'.

instance.unable-to-connect-instance-to-check-migr: Unable to connect instance to check migration schema
instance.bytebase-relies-on-migration-schema-to-m: Bytebase relies on migration schema to record database schema migration on this instance. Without setting up the migration schema, you cannot edit schema or change data for any databases on the instance.
instance.please-contact-your-dba-to-configure-it: Please contact your DBA to configure it.
instance.please-check-the-instance-connection-inf: Please check the instance connection info is correct.
instance.failed-to-create-migration-schema-for-in: Failed to create migration schema for instance '{0}'.
instance.failed-to-sync-schema-for-instance-insta: Failed to sync schema for instance '{0}'.
instance.archived-instances-will-not-be-shown-on-: Archived instances will not be shown on the normal interface. You can click "Archive" on the bottom left to find and restore it.
instance.name: Name
instance.below-is-an-example-to-create-user-byteb: Below is an example to create user 'bytebase{'@'}%' with password
instance.no-read-only-data-source-warn-for-owner-: The instance has not configured read-only connection, please consider adding one.
instance.no-read-only-data-source-warn-for-develo: The instance has not configured read-only connection, please ask your DBA to add one.

proxy.snowflake: For proxy server, append {'@'}PROXY_HOST and specify PROXY_PORT in the port

console.snowflake: The external console URL managing this instance (e.g. AWS RDS console, your in-house DB instance console)

sentence.outbound-ip-list: If you make use of inbound firewall rules for your database instance, please include the following IP addresses in its allowlist to allow access by Bytebase Cloud.
sentence.create-admin-user: This is the connection user used by Bytebase to perform DDL and DML (non-SELECT) operations.
sentence.create-readonly-user: This is the connection used by Bytebase to perform read-only operations such as SELECT query.
sentence.create-admin-user-non-sql: This is the connection user used by Bytebase to perform write and admin operations.
sentence.create-readonly-user-non-sql: This is the connection used by Bytebase to perform read-only operations.

snowflake.template: Below is an example to create user 'bytebase' with password {password} for {warehouse} and grant the user with the needed privileges.

mysql.template: Below is an example to create user {user} with password {password} and grant the user with the needed privileges.

clickhouse.template: Below is an example to create user 'bytebase' with password {password} and grant the user with the needed privileges. First you need to enable ClickHouse SQL-driven workflow {link} and then run the following query to create the user.

postgresql.warn: If the connecting instance is managed by the cloud provider, then SUPERUSER is not available and you should create the user via that provider's admin console. The created user will have provider specific semi-SUPERUSER privileges. You should grant Bytebase privileges with 'GRANT role_name TO bytebase;' for all existing roles, otherwise Bytebase may not access existing databases or tables.
postgresql.template: Below is an example to create user 'bytebase' with password {password} and grant the user with the needed privileges. If the connecting instance is self-hosted, then you can grant SUPERUSER.

redis.template: Below is an example to create user {user} with password {password} and grant the user with the needed privileges.

instance.type-or-paste-credentials-write-only: Type or paste CREDENTIALS - write only
instance.secret-manager-tip: You can also specify external secret manage endpoint
instance.add-a-postgresql-sample-instance: Add a PostgreSQL sample instance instead
instance.successfully-added-postgresql-instance: Successfully added a PostgreSQL sample instance and filled connection info.
instance.connection-info-seems-to-be-incorrect: Connection info seems to be incorrect
instance.unable-to-connect:
Bytebase is unable to connect the instance. We recommend you to review the connection info again. But it's OK to ignore this warning for now. You can still fix the connection info from the instance detail page after creation.

Error detail: {0}
instance.copy-grant-statement: CREATE USER and GRANT statements copied to clipboard. Paste to your {engine} client to apply.
instance.failed-to-connect-instance-localhost:
Failed to connect instance.
If you run Bytebase with Docker, please try "host.docker.internal" for the host address.
instance.find-gcp-project-id-and-instance-id: To find GCP Project ID and instance ID, see
instance.force-archive-description: Force to archive. All releated issues will be resolved, and all related sheets will be deleted.

database.description: The entire database is treated as a managed object, with CDB and PDB being regarded as distinct databases. (Supports CDB and non-CDB mode)

schema.description: Each schema is treated as a managed object. (Only supports non-CDB mode)

scan-interval.description: Bytebase periodically syncs instance schema and detects anomalies.

environment.id-description: The Environment ID is the unique identifier for your environment. You cannot change it after created.
environment.archive-info: Archived environment will not be shown on the normal interface. You can click "Archive" on the bottom left to find and restore it.

disable-auto-backup.content:
Disabling automatic backup policy is not applied retroactively.
Are you sure about applying to all databases in this environment?

quick-start.guide: click on the step to try it out

notice.title: Quickstart guide dismissed
notice.desc: You can still bring it back later from the top right menu

sign-in.title: Sign in to your account
sign-in.gitlab-oauth: Reach to your Admin to enable GitLab login

password-forget.title: Forgot your password?
password-forget.content: Please contact your Bytebase Admin to reset your password.

password-reset.title: Reset your password
password-reset.content: Enter your email address and we will send you a password reset link

rollout.name: Rollout policy
rollout.tip: The policy is applied to issues retroactively.
rollout.info: For rolling out database change, this setting controls whether the rollout requires manual approval.
rollout.manual-info: Require clicking "Rollout" button manually, and then the change will be executed.
rollout.auto-info: If all check pass, the change will be rolled out and executed automatically.

assignee-group.workspace-owner-or-dba: Require rolling out from DBA or workspace owner.
assignee-group.project-owner: Require rolling out from project owner.

rollout.manual-by-dba-or-workspace-owner: Require rolling out from DBA or workspace owner.
rollout.manual-by-last-approver: Manual rollout by the last approver from the custom approval flow
rollout.manual-by-dedicated-roles-info: Allow any of the following selected roles to click the "Rollout" button, and then the change will be executed.

role.last-approver: The last approver from the custom approval flow

backup.name: Database backup schedule policy
backup.tip: The policy is not applied retroactively.
backup.daily-info: Enforce every database to backup daily.
backup.weekly-info: Enforce every database to backup weekly.

environment-tier.name: Environment tier
environment-tier.description: The environment will appear differently from other environments.

change-history.select: Schema version is recorded each time a schema change is applied via Bytebase
change-history.no-schema-change: this migration has no schema change
change-history.schema-snapshot-after-change: The schema snapshot recorded after applying this change
change-history.list-limit: For database having change history, we list up to 5 most recent histories below. You can click the database name to view all histories.
change-history.no-history-in-project: Do not find change history from any database in this project.
change-history.recording-info: Change history is recorded whenever the database schema is altered.
change-history.establish-baseline-description: Bytebase will use the current schema as the new baseline. This would reconcile the actual schema state with the recorded schema state in Bytebase and fix the reported schema drift. You should only do this if the current schema does reflect the desired state.
change-history.instance-missing-change-schema: Missing change history schema on instance "{name}".
change-history.instance-bad-connection: Unable to connect instance "{name}" to retrieve change history.
change-history.contact-dba: Please contact your DBA to config it
change-history.need-to-select-first: Need to select change history first

database.the-list-might-be-out-of-date-and-is-ref: The list might be out of date and is refreshed roughly every 10 minutes
database.mixed-values-for-label: This selected label have mixed values
database.mixed-label-values-warning: Some of the selected resources have mixed values for the same key
database.batch-action-disabled: Can not {action} for the databases from different projects
database.backuppolicy-backup-enforced-and-cant-be: {0} backup enforced and can't be disabled
database.an-http-post-request-will-be-sent-to-it-: An HTTP POST request will be sent to it after a successful backup.

backup-info.template: Backup will be taken on every {dayOrWeek} at {time}. Backup data will be kept for {retentionDays} days.

database.updated-backup-webhook-url-for-database-: Updated backup webhook URL for database '{0}'.
database.restore-backup: Restore backup '{0}' to a new database
database.incorrect-project-warning: SQL editor can only query databases in projects available to the user. You should first transfer this database into a project.

pitr.help-info: Restore the database state to a point in time. {link}.
pitr.no-earlier-than: Restore point-in-time cannot be earlier than [{earliest}] (the earliest available backup).
pitr.no-later-than-now: Restore point-in-time cannot be later than now.
pitr.restore-before-last-migration: Restore to the point before last migration

database.not-found-last-successful-sync-was: Not found, last successful sync was {time}
database.select-databases-from-same-project: Please select databases from the same project

sync-schema.title: Sync Schema
sync-schema.description: Bytebase supports synchronizing a schema to one or multiple target databases.
sync-schema.select-database-placeholder: Select database (MySQL, PostgreSQL, TiDB, Oracle only)

schema-version.description: Schema version is recorded each time a schema change is applied via Bytebase

message.select-a-target-database-first: Please select a target database first.

sync-schema.synchronize-statements-description: You can further edit the generated DDL statements
sync-schema.select-from-database-and-schema-tip: Select the database and schema version to be synced from
sync-schema.select-to-database-tip: Select the database to be applied to
sync-schema.character-sets-diff-found: There are differences between character sets.

database.access-denied: You don't have the permission to access this database.
database.doesnt-match-database-name-template: Doesn't match tenant database name template
database.should-follow-database-name-template: Should follow tenant database name template
database.show-schemaless-databases: Show schemaless databases. (Edit Schema is not applicable for schemaless databases.)

validation.name-pattern-mismatch: Secret name should contain only uppercase letters, digit, or _ (underscore)
validation.name-cannot-start-with-number: Secret name cannot start with number

secret.description: You can use secret in the change script to hide sensitive information, please refer to {guide}

database.transfer-database-from-to: Transfer database from source project to target project

repository.our-webhook-link: The webhook created by Bytebase can be found at {webhookLink}.
repository.branch-observe-file-change: The branch where Bytebase observes the file change.
repository.base-directory-description: The root directory where Bytebase observes the file change. If empty, then it observes the entire repository.
repository.file-path-template-description: Bytebase only observes the file path name matching the template pattern relative to the base directory.
repository.file-path-example-schema-migration: File path example for schema migration type
repository.file-path-example-data-migration: File path example for data migration type
repository.schema-writeback-description: When specified, after each migration, Bytebase will write the latest schema to the schema path relative to the base directory in the same branch as the original commit triggering the migration. Leave empty if you don't want Bytebase to do this.
repository.schema-writeback-protected-branch: Make sure the changed branch is not protected or allow repository maintainer to push to that protected branch.
repository.sheet-path-template-description: Bytebase only observes files with pathnames matching the template pattern relative to the base directory. The matched files will be synchronized to the SQL Editor for usage there.
repository.sql-review-ci-enable-gitlab: Enable SQL Review CI via GitLab CI
repository.sql-review-ci-enable-github: Enable SQL Review CI via GitHub Action
repository.sql-review-ci-enable-azure: Enable SQL Review CI via Azure DevOps Pipeline
repository.sql-review-ci-description: Bytebase will create a {pr} to set up the SQL review CI in your repository. In every {pr}, environment-based SQL review policy will check against changed files matching the "{pathTemplate}".
repository.sql-review-ci-setup-failed: Failed to setup SQL Review CI
repository.sql-review-ci-loading-modal: We're preparing the {pr} to set up the SQL review CI. Once set up, you will be redirected to the {pr} page.
repository.sql-review-ci-setup-modal: We have created a {pr} for your repository to set up the SQL review CI. Please review and merge the {pr}.
repository.sql-review-ci-remove-modal: SQL Review CI is disabled. You can remove the {vcs} file from {repository}.
repository.sql-review-ci-restore-modal: Once you restore to the UI workflow, the SQL review CI will be disabled for your repository. You can remove the {vcs} file from {repository}.
repository.gitops-description-file-path: Database migration scripts are stored in {fullPath}. To make schema changes, a developer would create a migration script matching file path pattern {fullPathTemplate}.
repository.gitops-description-branch: After the script is review approved and merged into the {branch} branch, Bytebase will automatically kicks off the pipeline to apply the new schema change.
repository.gitops-description-description-schema-pa: After applying the schema change, Bytebase will also write the latest schema to the specified schema path location {schemaPathTemplate}.
repository.gitops-description-sdl: Database migration scripts are stored in {fullPath}. To make schema changes, a developer would modify the full schema script matching file path pattern {schemaPathTemplate}. To make data changes, a developer would create a migration script matching file path pattern {filePathTemplate}. Once the script is merged into the {branch} branch, Bytebase will automatically kick off the pipeline to apply the new database change.
repository.restore-ui-workflow-description: When using the UI workflow, the developer submits a SQL review ticket directly from Bytebase console and waits for the assigned DBA or peer developer to review. Bytebase applies the SQL change after review approved.
repository.setup-wizard-guide: If you encounter errors during the process, please refer to our {guide}
repository.choose-git-provider-description: Choose the Git provider where your database schema scripts (.sql) are hosted. When you push the changed script to the Git repository, Bytebase will automatically create a pipeline to apply the schema change to the database.
repository.choose-git-provider-visit-workspace: Visit {workspace} setting to add more Git providers.
repository.choose-git-provider-contact-workspace-ow: Contact your Bytebase owner if you want other Git providers to appear here. Bytebase currently supports self-host GitLab EE/CE, and plan to add GitLab.com, and GitHub Enterprise later.
repository.select-repository-attention-gitlab: Bytebase only lists GitLab projects granting you at least the 'Maintainer' role, which allows to configure the project webhook to observe the code push event.
repository.select-repository-attention-github: Bytebase only lists GitHub repositories you have admin permissions, which allows to configure the repository webhook to observe the code push event.
repository.select-repository-attention-bitbucket: Bytebase only lists Bitbucket repositories you have admin permissions, which allows to configure the repository webhook to observe the code push event.
repository.select-repository-attention-azure-devops: Bytebase only lists Azure DevOps repositories under the organization which third-party application access via OAuth is granted. If you don't see the repository you want, please go to Organization -> Organization Settings -> Policies to enable third-party application access.

workflow.ui-workflow-description: Classic SQL Review workflow where the developer submits a SQL review ticket directly from Bytebase and waits for the assigned DBA or peer developer to review. Bytebase applies the SQL schema change after review approved.
workflow.gitops-workflow-description: Database migration scripts are stored in a git repository. To make schema changes, a developer would create a migration script and submit for review in the corresponding VCS such as GitLab. After the script is approved and merged into the configured branch, Bytebase will automatically kicks off the task to apply the new schema change.

anomaly.attention-desc: Bytebase periodically detects anomalies based on the instance scan interval, and surfaces the findings here.
anomaly.tooltip: {env} has {criticalCount} CRITICAL, {highCount} HIGH and {mediumCount} MEDIUM anomalies

modal.title: How to setup '@:{'common.project'}' ?
modal.content:
Bytebase project is similar to the project concept in other common dev tools.

A project has its own members, and every issue and database always belongs to a single project.

A project can also be configured to link to a repository to enable GitOps workflow.

overview.info-slot-content: Bytebase periodically syncs the instance schema. Newly synced databases are first placed here. User should transfer them to the proper application project.
overview.no-db-prompt: No database belongs to this project. You can add database by clicking {newDb} or {transferInDb} from the top action bar.

no-webhook.title: No webhook configured for this project.
no-webhook.content: Configure webhooks to let Bytebase post notification to the external systems on various events.

creation.title: Create webhook
creation.desc: Create the corresponding webhook for the {destination} channel receiving the message.
creation.how-to-protect: If you want to use keyword list to protect the webhook, you can add "Bytebase" to that list.

deletion.confirm-title: Delete webhook '{title}' and all its execution history?

issue-creation.title: Issue creation
issue-creation.label: When new issue has been created

issue-stage-status-change.title: Issue stage status change
issue-stage-status-change.label: When issue's enclosing stage status has changed

issue-task-status-change.title: Issue task status change
issue-task-status-change.label: When issue's enclosing task status has changed

issue-info-change.title: Issue info change
issue-info-change.label: When issue info (e.g. assignee, title, description) has changed

issue-comment-creation.title: Issue comment creation
issue-comment-creation.label: When new issue comment has been created

issue-task-run-status-change.title: Issue task run status change
issue-task-run-status-change.label: When issue task run status has changed

settings.success-member-deleted-prompt: Successfully revoked {name} access from the project.

archive.title: Archive project
archive.description: Archived project will not be shown on the normal interface. You can click "Archive" on the bottom left to find and restore it.

force.description: Force to archive. All releated issues will be resolved, and all related sheets will be deleted.

settings.select-schema-change-type-ddl: Imperative - Specify the change with any DDL statements.
settings.select-schema-change-type-sdl: Declarative - Specify the desired schema. Only use CREATE TABLE/INDEX.
settings.schema-path-template-sdl-description: The schema file describes the database's full schema.

branch-name-pattern.description: Support wildcard such as feature/* or *-stable

branch-protection-rules.applies-to-n-branches: Applies to {n} branch | Applies to {n} branches
branch-protection-rules.only-allow-specified-roles-to-create-bra: Only allow specified roles to create branch

members.description: Project members determine the permission to operate database and issues inside the proejct. Project Owner, Workspace Owner and Workspace DBA all have full project permissions.
members.cannot-remove-last-owner: Cannot remove the last owner of a project

project.key-hint: Short descriptive alphanumberic letters to identify this project.

setting.description: Bytebase supports GitOps workflow where database migration scripts are stored in the version control system (VCS), and newly created migration scripts will automatically trigger the corresponding database change. Bytebase owners manage all the applicable VCSs here, so that project owners can link the projects with their Git repositories from these VCSs.
setting.description-highlight: If you want to enable third party login via your configured VCSs, please configure it in SSO.

add-git-provider.description: Before any project can enable GitOps workflow, Bytebase first needs to integrate with the corresponding version control system (VCS) by registering as an OAuth application in that VCS. Below are the steps to configure this, you can also follow our {guide}.
add-git-provider.gitlab-self-host-admin-requirement: You need to be an Admin of your chosen GitLab instance to configure this. Otherwise, you need to ask your GitLab instance Admin to register Bytebase as a GitLab instance-wide OAuth application, then provide you that Application ID and Secret to fill at the 'OAuth application info' step.
add-git-provider.gitlab-com-admin-requirement: Your account needs to have Admin access to any of the repositories to be linked. Usually this account corresponds to a dedicated service user instead of a human user.
add-git-provider.github-com-admin-requirement: You need to be an admin of your chosen GitHub organization to configure this. Otherwise, you need to ask your GitHub organization admin to register Bytebase as a GitHub organization-wide OAuth application, then provide you that Application ID and Secret to fill at the 'OAuth application info' step.
add-git-provider.bitbucket-admin-requirement: You need to be an admin of your chosen Bitbucket workspace to configure this. Otherwise, you need to ask your Bitbucket workspace admin to register Bytebase as a Bitbucket workspace-wide OAuth application, then provide you that Application ID and Secret to fill at the 'OAuth application info' step.
add-git-provider.azure-admin-requirement: You need to be an admin of your chosen Azure DevOps organization to configure this. Otherwise, you need to ask your Bitbucket workspace admin to register Bytebase as a Azure DevOps organization-wide OAuth application, then provide you that Application ID and Client Secret to fill at the 'OAuth application info' step.
add-git-provider.check-oauth-info-match: Please make sure Secret matches the one from your GitLab instance Application.

basic-info.gitlab-instance-url-label: The VCS instance URL. Make sure this instance and Bytebase are network reachable from each other.
basic-info.instance-url-error: Instance URL must begin with https:// or http://
basic-info.display-name-label: An optional display name to help identifying among different configs using the same Git provider.

oauth-info.gitlab-self-host-register-oauth-applicat: Register Bytebase as a GitLab instance-wide OAuth application.
oauth-info.gitlab-self-host-login-as-admin: Log in as an Admin user to the GitLab instance. The account must be an Admin of the entire GitLab instance (it has a wrench icon on the top bar).
oauth-info.gitlab-self-host-visit-admin-page: Go to the Admin page by clicking the wrench icon, then navigate to "Applications" section and click "New application" button.
oauth-info.gitlab-com-register-oauth-application: Register Bytebase as a GitLab user OAuth application.
oauth-info.gitlab-com-login: Log in as whichever account you want Bytebase to act as. Usually this account corresponds to a dedicated service user instead of a human user.
oauth-info.azure-devops-login: Log in as whichever account you want Bytebase to act as. Usually this account corresponds to a dedicated service user instead of a human user.
oauth-info.gitlab-com-visit-application-page: Go to Preferences -> Applications page. You can reach it through your profile picture on the top right corner.
oauth-info.gitlab-paste-oauth-info: Paste the Application ID and Secret from that just created application into fields below.
oauth-info.azure-paste-oauth-info: Paste the Application ID and Client Secret from that just created application into fields below.
oauth-info.github-register-oauth-application: Register Bytebase as a GitHub organization-wide OAuth application.
oauth-info.github-login-as-admin: Log in as an organization admin user to the GitHub.com. The account must be an organization admin of the GitHub organization (able to access the organization Settings page).
oauth-info.github-visit-admin-page: Go to the Settings page, then navigate to "Developer settings > OAuth Apps" section and click "Register an application" button.
oauth-info.github-paste-oauth-info: Paste the Client ID and Client secret from that just created application into fields below.
oauth-info.github-enterprise-login-as-admin: Log in as an organization admin user to your hosted GitHub Enterprise site. The account must be an organization admin of the GitHub organization (able to access the organization Settings page).
oauth-info.bitbucket-register-oauth-application: Register Bytebase as a Bitbucket workspace-wide OAuth consumer.
oauth-info.azure-register-oauth-application: Register Bytebase as a Azure DevOps organization-wide OAuth consumer.
oauth-info.bitbucket-login-as-admin: Log in as an workspace admin user to the Bitbucket.org. The account must be an workspace admin of the Bitbucket workspace (able to access the workspace Settings page).
oauth-info.bitbucket-visit-admin-page: Go to the Settings page, then navigate to "APPS AND FEATURES > OAuth consumers" section and click "Add a consumer" button.
oauth-info.bitbucket-paste-oauth-info: Paste the Key and Secret from that just created consumer into fields below.
oauth-info.copy-homepage-url: Homepage URL copied to clipboard. Paste to the corresponding field on the OAuth application form.
oauth-info.copy-redirect-uri: Redirect URI copied to clipboard. Paste to the corresponding field on the OAuth application form.
oauth-info.create-oauth-app: Create your Bytebase OAuth application with the following info.
oauth-info.gitlab-application-id-error: Application ID must be a 64-character alphanumeric string
oauth-info.gitlab-secret-error: Secret must be a 64-character alphanumeric string
oauth-info.github-application-id-error: Application ID must be a 20-character alphanumeric string. Please make sure it is a OAuth App instead of a GitHub App.
oauth-info.github-secret-error: Secret must be a 40-character alphanumeric string
oauth-info.bitbucket-application-id-error: Application ID must be a 18-character alphanumeric string
oauth-info.bitbucket-secret-error: Secret must be a 32-character alphanumeric string

confirm.confirm-description: After creation, this Git provider can be chosen under the project dashboard "GitOps" tab by the project owner.

git-provider.gitlab-self-host-application-id-label: Application ID for the registered GitLab instance-wide OAuth application.
git-provider.gitlab-com-application-id-label: Application ID for the registered GitLab OAuth application.
git-provider.gitlab-self-host-secret-label: Secret for the registered GitLab instance-wide OAuth application.
git-provider.gitlab-com-secret-label: Secret for the registered GitLab OAuth application.
git-provider.azure-secret-label: Client secret for the registered Azure OAuth application.
git-provider.github-application-id-label: Client ID for the registered GitHub organization-wide OAuth application.
git-provider.azure-application-id-label: Client ID for the registered Azure organization-wide OAuth application.
git-provider.secret-label-github: Client secret for the registered GitHub organization-wide OAuth application.
git-provider.delete-forbidden: To delete this provider, unlink all repositories first.

deployment-config.this-is-example-deployment-config: This is the deployment config example. You need to edit and save it.

error.at-least-one-selector: At least 1 selector in each stage
error.env-in-selector-required: "Environment ID" is required in each stage
error.env-selector-must-has-one-value: "Environment ID" must has exactly one value

deployment-config.project-has-no-deployment-config: This project has no deployment config yet. Please {go} first.
deployment-config.wont-be-deployed-explanation: These databases won't be deployed, since they hit none of the selectors.
deployment-config.pipeline-generated-from-deployment-confi: The deployment pipeline is generated according to the project's {deployment_config}.

data-source.revoke-access: Are you sure to revoke '{0}' access from '{1}'?
data-source.we-also-linked-the-granted-database-to-t: We also linked the granted database to the requested issue '{0}'.

project.description: This is the Admin project panel listing all projects in Bytebase.

sql-editor.table-empty-placeholder: Click Run to execute the query.
sql-editor.only-select-allowed: Only {select} statements are allowed to execute.
sql-editor.want-to-action: If you want to {want}, click the {action} button {reaction}.
sql-editor.table-schema-placeholder: Select a table to see its schema
sql-editor.notify-empty-statement: Please input your SQL statements in the editor
sql-editor.notify-multiple-statements: Multiple SQL statements detected. SQL Editor only executes the first statement. You can select another statement and execute it individually.
sql-editor.goto-edit-schema-hint: Please select a database connection from the top of the editor
sql-editor.can-not-execute-query: Cannot execute query when loading data.

confirm-to-close-unsaved-sheet.title: Close the unsaved sheet?
confirm-to-close-unsaved-sheet.content: Close the sheet and lose any unsaved data?

notify.copy-share-link: The share link was copied to Clipboard.

sql-editor.connection-holder: Associate a database first from the Database Panel on the left
sql-editor.private-desc: Only you can access this sheet
sql-editor.project-desc: Both sheet OWNER and project OWNER can read/write, and project DEVELOPER can read
sql-editor.public-desc: Sheet OWNER can read/write, and all others can read
sql-editor.sql-execute-in-production-environment: Be careful, you are accessing a database in a production environment.
sql-editor.rows-upper-limit: reached the limit of query results
sql-editor.allow-admin-mode-only: Instance {instance} is accessible in admin mode only.
sql-editor.connection-lost: Connection lost. Will try to reconnect when executing next query.

confirm-to-close.title: Confirm to close
confirm-to-close.description: Are you sure you want to close the panel? Your changes will be lost.

schema-editor.tenant-mode-tips: Changes will be applied to all selected tenant databases after clicking "Preview issue".
schema-editor.select-reference-schema: Select a schema to reference to
schema-editor.select-reference-table: Select a table to reference to
schema-editor.select-reference-column: Select a column to reference to

error.key-format: Only alphanumeric characters ([a-z0-9A-Z]), hyphens (-), underscores (_) and dots (.) are allowed. And must begin and ends with alphanumeric characters.

setting.description: A label is a key-value pair that helps you identify the tenant for a database. {link}.

label.db-name-template-tips: Specify a template to enforce database naming. For example, if your database db1 is geo-splitted into US, Asia, Europe and you want to enforce names as db1__US, db1__ASIA, db1__EU, then the template could be {placeholder}. {link}.
label.cannot-transfer-template-not-match: Database '{name}' cannot be transferred to this project. Since its name doesn't match the template {template}.

trial-start-modal.title: Start your {plan} trial
trial-start-modal.content: Your {plan} trial has started! You can access {plan} features before {date}.
trial-start-modal.subscription: Go to the {page} to learn these features and our plans.

subscription.description: You can upload your Bytebase license to unlock pro/enterprise features.
subscription.start-n-days-trial: Start {days} days trial (no credit card required)
subscription.successfully-start-trial: Successfully start free trial for {days} days
subscription.require-subscription: This feature requires {requiredPlan}, please purchase Bytebase license to unlock this feature.
subscription.trial-for-plan: You can start a free trial for {plan} with {days} days - no credit card required
subscription.trial-for-days: You can start a free trial for {days} days - no credit card required
subscription.upgrade-trial: You can upgrade your free trial to this plan
subscription.contact-to-upgrade: Contact your Workspace Owner or DBA to upgrade the plan

instance-assignment.missing-license-attention: You need to assign license to the instance to enable this feature.
instance-assignment.missing-license-for-instances: You have {count} instances ({name}) missing required license to unlock this feature.
instance-assignment.missing-license-for-feature: Missing instance license to enable {feature}. Click to assign now.

success.title: Successfully updated license
success.description: Premium features in subscription plan unlocked.

failure.title: Failed to update license
failure.description: Please check if your license is valid.

subscription.overuse-warning: {neededPlan} on {currentPlan} will be restricted. Upgrade now to ensure continued access.

overuse-modal.description: You are using features unavailable in the {plan}. Upgrade now to ensure continued access:

bb-feature-task-schedule-time.title: Set task schedule time
bb-feature-task-schedule-time.desc: Set task schedule time allows you to set a specific time to run your tasks.

bb-feature-instance-count.title: Instance count limit
bb-feature-instance-count.desc: You have reached the maximum instance count limit. Please upgrade to get more instance quota.
bb-feature-instance-count.remaining: Your total instance quota is {total}, only have {count} instance remained.
bb-feature-instance-count.runoutof: Your have run out of your {total} instance quota.

bb-feature-user-count.title: User count limit
bb-feature-user-count.desc: You have reached the maximum user count limit. Please upgrade to get unlimited user quota.
bb-feature-user-count.remaining: Your total user quota is {total}, only have {count} user remained.
bb-feature-user-count.runoutof: Your have run out of your {total} user quota.

bb-feature-multi-tenancy.title: Batch mode
bb-feature-multi-tenancy.desc: Batch changing a group of databases from different tenants or partitions.

bb-feature-approval-policy.title: Rollout policy
bb-feature-approval-policy.desc: Rollout policy controls whether the schema change task requires manual rolling out.

bb-feature-backup-policy.title: Backup policy
bb-feature-backup-policy.desc: Backup policy will auto-backup your database based on the schedule.

bb-feature-sensitive-data.title: Sensitive data
bb-feature-sensitive-data.desc: Mark table columns as sensitive data and the query result of them will be displayed as "******".

bb-feature-access-control.title: Data Access control
bb-feature-access-control.desc: Configure approval flow to control data query and export.

bb-feature-lgtm.title: LGTM check
bb-feature-lgtm.desc: Check if the issue has an "LGTM" comment.

bb-feature-sql-review.title: Unlock 100+ SQL Review checks
bb-feature-sql-review.desc: Specify SQL lint rules to adopt SQL best practice and enforce schema consistency across the engineering organization.

bb-feature-custom-approval.title: Custom approval
bb-feature-custom-approval.desc: Configure risk level and approval flow for different tasks.

bb-feature-vcs-schema-write-back.title: Schema write-back
bb-feature-vcs-schema-write-back.desc: After a successful schema change, schema write-back enables Bytebase to write back the latest full schema snapshot to your VCS repository.

bb-feature-vcs-sheet-sync.title: Synchronize SQL scripts from VCS
bb-feature-vcs-sheet-sync.desc: Synchronize SQL scripts stored in VCS to Sheet.

bb-feature-vcs-sql-review.title: SQL Review in GitOps workflow
bb-feature-vcs-sql-review.desc: Add the SQL Review CI to your VCS repository pipeline. SQL Review will be triggered in the pull request for changed SQL files.

bb-feature-rbac.title: Role management
bb-feature-rbac.desc: Role management can assign a particular role (e.g. DBA) to a member.

bb-feature-custom-role.title: Custom role
bb-feature-custom-role.desc: Defining custom roles. You may apply them to project members and used in custom approval flow.

bb-feature-watermark.title: Watermark
bb-feature-watermark.desc: Display visible watermarks on pages, including username, ID and email.

bb-feature-audit-log.title: Audit log
bb-feature-audit-log.desc: Record and query operations performed by users in workspace.

bb-feature-schema-drift.title: Schema drift
bb-feature-schema-drift.desc: Detect out-of-band schema changes and report schema drift.

bb-feature-online-migration.title: Online migration
bb-feature-online-migration.desc: Based on gh-ost. For large tables, it can reduce the table lock duration from hours to seconds.

bb-feature-disaster-recovery-pitr.title: Point-in-Time-Recovery (PITR)
bb-feature-disaster-recovery-pitr.desc: Restore the database state to a point in time.

bb-feature-sync-schema-all-versions.title: Synchronize schema all versions
bb-feature-sync-schema-all-versions.desc: Select any arbitrary migration version from the base database and synchronize it to the target database.

bb-feature-read-replica-connection.title: Read replica connection
bb-feature-read-replica-connection.desc: Connect to a read replica for the read-only data source.

bb-feature-instance-ssh-connection.title: Instance SSH connection
bb-feature-instance-ssh-connection.desc: Connect to a instance over SSH.

bb-feature-custom-instance-scan-interval.title: Custom instance scan interval
bb-feature-custom-instance-scan-interval.desc: Customize schema and anomaly scan interval for instance

bb-feature-index-advisor.title: Index advisor
bb-feature-index-advisor.desc: Index advisor can help you to find the missing indexes in slow queries.

bb-feature-sso.title: Single Sign-On (SSO)
bb-feature-sso.desc: Enables users to securely authenticate with multiple applications and websites via a single set of credentials.

bb-feature-2fa.title: Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)
bb-feature-2fa.desc: Two-factor authentication provides an extra layer of security for member accounts. When signing in, you will be required to enter the security code generated by your Authenticator App.

bb-feature-plugin-openai.title: AI Augmentation
bb-feature-plugin-openai.desc: AI augmented SQL Editor and index advisor features powered by OpenAI.

bb-feature-batch-query.title: Batch query
bb-feature-batch-query.desc: Batch query additional databases under same project in SQL Editor.

bb-feature-shared-sql-script.title: Shared SQL script
bb-feature-shared-sql-script.desc: Share your SQL scripts with project teammates or make them public to all.

bb-feature-encrypted-secrets.title: Encrypted Secrets
bb-feature-encrypted-secrets.desc: Store your secrets of database and use them in your issue SQL scripts.

bb-feature-database-grouping.title: Database Group
bb-feature-database-grouping.desc: Database group allows you to apply batch operations to the databases from the database group.

bb-feature-disallow-signup.title: Disable self-service signup
bb-feature-disallow-signup.desc: Once disabled, users cannot self-service signup and can only be invited by the workspace owner.

bb-feature-schema-template.title: Schema Template
bb-feature-schema-template.desc: Pre-define the field template, then apply the template during the schema change.

bb-feature-secure-token.title: Sign-in frequency
bb-feature-secure-token.desc: Sign-in frequency is the period before a user must sign in again.

bb-feature-issue-advanced-search.title: Advanced issue search
bb-feature-issue-advanced-search.desc: Access unlimited issue history with advanced issue search.

sheet.from-issue-warning: The sheet comes from issue {issue} in read-only mode. {oversize}
sheet.content-oversize-warning: SQL is oversized and inline-editing is disallowed.

sql-review.title: SQL Review
sql-review.description: SQL review policy can define different set of SQL lint rules for the respective environments. It helps teams to adopt SQL best practice and enforce schema consistency across different databases. Whenever you attempt a DDL/DML change or use SQL Editor to query data, the query will be checked against the configured SQL review policy.
sql-review.no-permission: Only DBA or Owner has permission to create or update review policy.
sql-review.input-then-press-enter: Input the value then press enter to add

basic-info.name: Basic info
basic-info.display-name-label: A display name to help identifying among different review policies.
basic-info.environments-label: Apply the review policy to the selected environments. One environment can only link one policy.
basic-info.no-available-environment-desc: No available environment. One environment can only link one SQL review policy.

create-database-guide.click-new-project: Click "New Project" to create a project
create-database-guide.click-new-database: Click "New Database" to create a database
create-database-guide.wait-issue-finished: Waiting for the change to be finished...

test-modal.title: Test OAuth2 Connection
test-modal.start-test: Click sign in to get start testing

resource-id.description: The {resource} ID is a unique identifier. You cannot change it after created.

validation.duplicated: The {resource} ID already exists. Please choose another one.
validation.pattern: The {resource} ID can only contain lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens. It must start with a lowercase letter.
validation.minlength: The {resource} ID is too short. It should have at least 1 character.
validation.overflow: The {resource} ID is too long. It should have less than 64 characters.

use-auth-app.description: Open the two-factor authenticator (TOTP) app on your mobile device to view your authentication code.

use-recovery-code.description: If you are unable to access your mobile device, enter one of your recovery codes to verify your identity.

two-factor.description: Two-factor authentication provides an extra layer of security for member accounts. When signing in, you will be required to enter the security code generated by your Authenticator App.

setup-auth-app.description: Use a phone app like Google Authenticator, Microsoft Authenticator, or Authy to get 2FA codes when prompted during sign-in.

scan-qr-code.description: Use an authenticator app from your phone to scan. If you are unable to scan, {action} instead.

setup-auth-app.verify-code: Verify the code from the app

download-recovery-codes.tips: Keep your recovery codes as safe as your password. We recommend saving them with a password manager such as Lastpass, 1Password, or Keeper.

keep-safe.self: Keep your recovery codes in a safe spot.
keep-safe.description: These codes are the last resort for accessing your account in case you lose your two-factor authentication code. If you cannot find these codes, you will lose access to your account.

setup-steps.recovery-codes-saved: I have saved my recovery codes

recovery-codes.description: Recovery codes can be used to access your account in the event you cannot receive two-factor authentication codes.

disable.description: You are about to disable two-factor authentication for your account. You will no longer be required to enter the security code generated by your Authenticator App when signing in.

your-two-factor-secret.description: Copy the code and enter it in your TOTP app manually.
your-two-factor-secret.copy-succeed: Secret copied to clipboard. Paste it into your app.

messages.2fa-required: Two-factor authentication is required in your workspace. Please enable it before you can continue.
messages.cannot-disable: You cannot disable two-factor authentication because your admin requires it in the workspace.

ai.text-to-sql-placeholder: Use natural language and Bytebase will convert it into SQL
ai.text-to-sql-disabled-placeholder: Enable ChatSQL capability by supplying an OpenAI API Key.

conversation.select-or-create: Select or {create} a conversation to start.

preset-suggestion.2: Which manager has most direct reports in each department?
preset-suggestion.3: What's the gender ratio in each department?

default-rules.description: The default rules will be executed when an issue fails to comply with the custom rules.

condition.description-tips: A condition is a rule that can be configured via an expression. For example, the condition "Environment is prod" will match issues executed in the "prod" environment.

or.description: Any of the following are true...

and.description: All of the following are true...

group.tooltip: A condition group is a collection of conditions connected by operators "And" and "Or".

condition.input-value-press-enter: Input value, press Enter to confirm
condition.add-root-condition-placeholder: Click "Add condition" or "Add condition group" to add condition

presets.environment-prod-high: The risk for the production environment is considered to be high.
presets.environment-dev-low: The risk value for the development environment is considered to be low.
presets.dml-in-environment-prod-10k-rows-high: In the production environment, if the number of rows to be updated or deleted exceeds 10000, the risk is considered to be high.
presets.create-database-in-environment-prod-mode: Creating a database in the production environment is considered to be a moderate risk.

approval-flow.description: For each operation type, configure custom condition, risk and approval flow.

node.description: Only one approval is required on this node when there are multiple approvers.

presets.owner-dba: The system defines the approval process, first the project Owner approves, then the DBA approves.
presets.owner: The system defines the approval process and only needs the project Owner o approve it.
presets.dba: The system defines the approval process and only needs DBA approval.
presets.admin: The system defines the approval process and only needs Administrator approval.
presets.owner-dba-admin: The system defines the approval process, first the project Owner approves, then the DBA approves, and finally the Administrator approves.

risk.description: Risk Center defines the risk levels for different database operations under different conditions. And risk levels determine the corresponding custom approval flows.

disallow-approve-reason.some-task-checks-are-still-running: Some task checks are still running

issue-review.no-one-matches-role: No one matches the role, contact project owner to assign one.

slow-query.attention-description: Bytebase periodically syncs slow query logs from instances. For MySQL instance, slow_query must be enabled first. For PostgreSQL instance, only databases with pg_stat_statements enabled will collect slow queries.
slow-query.sync-job-started: Sync jobs started. Please wait for the jobs to complete.

advise-index.setup-openai-key-to-enable: Setup OpenAI key to enable index advisor

no-log-placeholder.admin: Click the "Configure" button to fetch slow queries from the database instances or click the "Sync Now" button to sync slow query logs immediately
no-log-placeholder.developer: Click the "Sync Now" button to sync slow query logs immediately or contact Bytebase owners/DBAs to configure slow queries

field-template.description: You can pre-define the field template, then apply the template during the schema change.

column-type-restriction.description: You can restrict the allowed column types for each database engine.

messages.following-column-types-are-used: Following column types are still used by field template
messages.one-allowed-type-per-line: One allowed data type per line

table-template.description: You can pre-define the table template, then apply the template during the schema change.

form.category-desc: Select an existing category or create a new one

setting.description: Defining custom roles. You may apply them to project members and used in custom approval flow.

validation.pattern: {resource} can only contain lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens. It must start with a lowercase letter.

role.title: Title
role.expired-tip: The role might has been expired.

viewer.description: System defined project database viewer role

prev-editor.description: To batch change tables from the table group, you can reference that table group in SQL. Bytebase will generate a separate SQL for each table in the table group.

diff-editor.need-to-resolve-conflicts: Branch has been updated by others. You need to resolve the conflicts before you can merge.
diff-editor.discard-changes-confirm: Are you sure you want to discard all modifications?

schema-designer.select-database-placeholder: Select a database (MySQL, PostgreSQL and TiDB only)

error.select-at-least-one-change-to-export: Select at least one change to export
error.you-are-not-allowed-to-perform-this-acti: You are not allowed to perform this action

change-history.select-at-least-one-history-below: Select at least one history below

branch.select-at-least-one-branch-below: Select at least one branch below
